fields.problemStatement: Given a tree, determine whether or not it is a valid binary search tree. Recall that the value of any node in a binary search tree is greater than the value of its left child and less than the value of its right child. The input will be an array where the root note is at index 1 and for any node i, the left child is node 2i and the right child is node 2i+1.
fields.description: Check for valid binary search trees

fields.problemStatement: Find the Greatest Common Divisor of two numbers.
fields.description: Find the GCD of two numbers.
fields.pythonTemplate:
def gcd(a, b):
	# Your code goes here
	pass

N = int(raw_input())
for i in range(N):
	s = raw_input()
	a = [int(c) for c in s.split(' ')]
	g = gcd(a[0], a[1])
	print g

fields.expectedOutput:
olleh
siht si a ecnetnes taht lliw noos eb desrever
a ba cba dcba edcba ccbbaa ccbaa
fields.problemStatement: Given a sentence, reverse all of the letters in each of the words. For example, "two words" would become "owt sdrow." Words are guaranteed to consist of only lower case letters and will be separated by spaces.
fields.description: Reverse the letters of words in a sentence.
fields.standardInput:
3
hello
this is a sentence that will soon be reversed
a ab abc abcd abcde aabbcc aabcc
fields.pythonTemplate:
def reverse(sentence):
	# Your code goes here
	pass

N = int(raw_input())
for i in range(N):
	sentence = raw_input()
	reversed = reverse(sentence)
	print reversed

fields.problemStatement: Remove the negative integers from the given array and return the result as a new array.
fields.pythonTemplate:
def positiveValues(a):
	# Your code goes here
	pass

def printArray(a):
	for n in a:

N = int(raw_input())
s = raw_input()
a = [int(c) for c in s.split(' ')]
ans = positiveValues(a)
printArray(ans)
